chaining_rules.description: Student has low APS (25-35) but expresses interest in international study

chain_sequence.content: Consider foundation/bridging programs at SA universities to boost APS
Explore community college → university transfer routes (US/CA)
Focus on need-based rather than merit-based scholarships
Plan 2-3 year pathway: Foundation → Strong performance → International application

chaining_rules.description: Student has high APS (38-42) but unclear career direction

chain_sequence.content: Present career options based on strongest subjects
Compare SA vs international opportunities for each career path
Apply to multiple high-value scholarships (Rhodes, Chevening, Allan Gray)
Consider gap year for career exploration and scholarship preparation

chaining_rules.description: Student requires special accommodations for learning or physical disabilities

chain_sequence.content: Identify specific accommodation needs and available support
Prioritize universities with strong disability support services
Access additional NSFAS allowances and specialized funding
Verify accessibility support at international universities if interested

chaining_rules.description: Student from rural area planning urban/international study

chain_sequence.content: Prioritize bursaries with rural student preferences (Anglo American, etc.)
Factor accommodation costs and cultural adjustment support
Include transport allowances and travel planning in budget
Highlight careers that can benefit rural communities (teaching, healthcare, engineering)

chaining_rules.description: Adult learner seeking university access through ABET qualification

chain_sequence.content: Explore Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) opportunities
Identify bridging programs at target universities
Access mature student support services and flexible study options
Align study choices with career change goals and life experience

chaining_rules.description: Student is first in family to attend university

chain_sequence.content: Provide detailed university system explanation and expectations
Connect with mentorship programs (Allan Gray, ISFAP, university programs)
Prioritize bursaries with comprehensive support (not just financial)
Provide resources to help explain university process to family

chaining_rules.description: Female student interested in male-dominated STEM fields

chain_sequence.content: Showcase successful women in target STEM fields
Identify universities and programs with strong gender diversity support
Highlight bursaries specifically supporting women in STEM
Connect with women in STEM networks and professional organizations
